meanings.definition: Load (something) into a device or system in advance.
meanings.sent1: Before playing the game, the system will start preloading the next level.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to enable preloading to speed up the website loading time.
meanings.sent3: The computer decided to prank its owner by preloading all cat videos before work.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a computer preloading information for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The chef's assistant was preloading ingredients for the evening rush, ensuring a smooth service.

meanings.definition: The act of loading something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The preloading of data onto the device saved time during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The preloading of supplies helped the team complete the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The preloading of snacks for the road trip made everyone excited for the journey.
meanings.sent4: His brain felt like a preloading of memories before the big family reunion.
meanings.sent5: The preloading of music playlists made the party atmosphere lively and fun.
